meanings.definition: The supporting framework underneath a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The undercarriage of the car was sturdy and reliable.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic inspected the undercarriage for any signs of damage.
meanings.sent3: When the undercarriage of the truck broke, it felt like a big puzzle to fix.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was the undercarriage that supported her through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The undercarriage of the plane was painted in bright colors for easy identification.

meanings.definition: The landing gear of an aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The undercarriage of the plane smoothly retracted after takeoff.
meanings.sent2: Pilots always check the undercarriage before landing to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The undercarriage of the helicopter looked like a set of mechanical legs.
meanings.sent4: The undercarriage of the jet resembled a complex system of support beams.
meanings.sent5: The undercarriage of the aircraft deployed with a loud mechanical sound.

meanings.definition: The lower part of a structure or machine.
meanings.sent1: The undercarriage of the building was reinforced to withstand earthquakes.
meanings.sent2: The engineer examined the undercarriage of the crane for any signs of wear.
meanings.sent3: The undercarriage of the robot was where all the important circuits were housed.
meanings.sent4: The undercarriage of the lawnmower was covered in grass clippings.
meanings.sent5: The undercarriage of the tractor was caked with mud after a day's work in the field.
